articles.title: Watch: BBC reporter tests AI anti-shoplifting tech
articles.summary: Some major retailers and independent stores have introduced AI body scans, CCTV or facial recognition equipment to identify crimes like shoplifting.

articles.title: Trump admin sends heart emoji to commercial spyware makers with lifted Predator sanctions
articles.summary:
Also, Korean Air hacked, EmEditor installer hijacked, a perfect 10 router RCE vuln, and more

infosec in brief  The Trump administration has cleared a trio of individuals sanctioned by the Biden administration for involvement with the Intellexa spyware consortium behind the Predator surveillance tool, removing restrictions that had barred them from doing business with the US.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses US government sanctions and policy changes regarding commercial spyware, which directly relates to the governance of information technology, security policies, and regulatory compliance.

articles.title: ExpressVPN's road to accessible privacy — is it really possible in 2026?
articles.summary: 2025 was a year of structural change for the industry giant. From breaking away from its one-size-fits-all pricing model to leading the charge on post-quantum standards, here is how ExpressVPN adapted to a changing market.
articles.reasoning: The article discusses technical backend adaptations, including post-quantum standards and engineering improvements, which relate to IT governance's emphasis on aligning IT strategy with business goals and managing IT resources effectively.

articles.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella becomes AI influencer, asks us all to move beyond slop
articles.summary:
Exec argues we need a new metaphor focused on AI as a lever rather than a job killer

Microsoft CEO and head AI peddler Satya Nadella wants you to know that it's time for the next phase of AI acceptance, where we focus on how humans are empowered by tools and agents and how we deploy resources to support this growth.…
articles.reasoning: The article touches on justifying AI investments, measuring returns, and focusing on how AI empowers humans, which relates to realizing expected benefits from technology initiatives.

articles.title: Palo Alto Networks security-intel boss calls AI agents 2026's biggest insider threat
articles.summary:
Lock 'em down

interview  AI agents represent the new insider threat to companies in 2026, according to Palo Alto Networks Chief Security Intel Officer Wendi Whitmore, and this poses several challenges to executives tasked with securing the expected surge in autonomous agents.…
articles.reasoning: The article mentions the benefits of AI agents in addressing cyber-skills gaps and improving security operations, which relates to realizing and measuring the value of technology investments, though it is less focused on formal benefit tracking.

articles.title: Cybercrook claims to be selling infrastructure info about three major US utilities
articles.summary:
For the bargain price of 6.5 bitcoin

A cybercrook claims to have breached Pickett and Associates, a Florida-based engineering firm whose clients include major US utilities, and is selling what they claim to be about 139 GB of engineering data about Tampa Electric Company, Duke Energy Florida, and American Electric Power. The price is 6.5 bitcoin, which amounts to about $585,000.…
articles.reasoning: The article describes a data breach involving large volumes of engineering files (e.g., LiDAR point clouds, design files), which directly relates to how data is stored, accessed, and potentially retrieved in forensic investigations.

articles.title: Users prompt Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot to remove clothes in photos then 'apologize' for it
articles.summary:
Repeat after me: Chatbots are not sentient and have no agency

Grok, the AI chatbot owned and operated by Elon Musk's xAI, is facing a firestorm of outrage after users prompted it to create images of naked and scantily clad people from real photographs, some of whom are underage.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses AI processing of user-uploaded images and text prompts, which involves data storage and retrieval from training datasets, though the core forensic focus is limited.
